title: Products That Raise the Bar on Home Water Savings and Efficiency - Pro Builder
summary: The article discusses various water-saving technologies and appliances aimed at reducing water usage and improving water quality for homeowners, including smart dishwashers, efficient toilets, digital shower valves, and filtration systems. These innovations promote sustainability by minimizing environmental impact and conserving resources while enhancing user experience. Many of the products are Energy Star certified or meet other regulatory standards for efficiency. The features include smart technology for water management and integrated leak detection, demonstrating a clear focus on promoting environmental responsibility.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the products and processes described in the article significantly reduce water consumption and improve water quality, which aligns with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the products and processes represent new or improved methods introduced to the market that significantly differ from previous offerings, aiming to enhance efficiency and user experience.
green_product: TRUE, because the products mentioned are designed to minimize environmental impact through efficient water usage, use of eco-friendly materials, and sustainable technologies.
green_process: TRUE, as the article details various methods and techniques associated with water and energy conservation that reduce environmental impacts during operational processes.
company: Beko, Icera, Kohler, Bosch, Rheem, GE, Soake Pools, Oasense, Kraus, Resideo, Niagara, Signature Kitchen Suite, Uponor, Flowban, Neoperl, Brizo

greenwashing: FALSE, as the article provides detailed, substantiated descriptions of the products' environmental benefits without misleading claims, thus promoting genuine green innovations.

title: Flume Q1 2023 Residential Water Use Index Ranks Indoor Efficiency By State - PR Newswire
summary: Flume Data Labs released their Q1 2023 Household Water Use Index, which assesses residential water use in the largest U.S. Metropolitan Statistical Areas. The report shows that states with comprehensive fixture efficiency standards result in lower average indoor water usage. Newer homes also exhibit lower indoor water use thanks to more efficient toilets. The analysis emphasizes the impact of state-level efficiency standards on water conservation.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses the impact of state efficiency standards and data analytics in promoting water conservation, aligning with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: The analysis and reporting by Flume Data Labs on water use efficiency represent a new or improved process in understanding and managing household water consumption.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not mention a specific good that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The use of real-time data monitoring and analysis to promote water efficiency reflects a method that minimizes environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541620 (Environmental Consulting Services), 611430 (Professional and Management Development Training), 541519 (Other Computer Related Services), 221310 (Water Supply and Irrigation Systems)
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not depict any misleading claims about environmental benefits; rather, it provides data-driven insights into water efficiency.

title: Grolsch Brewing Company: Drink Sustainably - Blog - Business & Environment - Harvard Business School
summary: In January 2023, HBS MBA students visited Grolsch Brewery in the Netherlands to learn about its sustainability initiatives, including sustainable packaging, resource efficiency, and energy sourcing. Notable innovations included the use of recyclable materials, improved water usage ratios, and a transition to renewable energy sources. The visit highlighted how the European energy crisis influenced investment in sustainability and the importance of regulatory support and industry collaboration in driving sustainable practices.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses various sustainability initiatives at Grolsch Brewery, including sustainable packaging, resource efficiency, and energy sourcing that significantly reduce environmental impacts, aligning with the definition of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article describes Grolsch Brewery's new or improved processes and products related to sustainability that differ significantly from their previous methods, fitting the definition of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The recyclable cardboard 'TopClip' and increased usage of sustainable packaging at Grolsch Brewery are examples of green products designed to minimize environmental impact, complying with the definition provided.
green_process: TRUE - Initiatives such as reducing the water-to-beer ratio and switching to renewable energy sources at Grolsch Brewery represent green processes that minimize environmental impacts in their production operations.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 312120 - Breweries, 312130 - Wineries, 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides comprehensive insights into Grolsch's genuine sustainability practices and initiatives, which are substantiated by their operational changes and commitment to environmental responsibility, indicating there is no greenwashing.

title: Making Better Essential: Pentair Showcases Positive Impact on People and the Planet in 2022 Corporate ... - businesswire.com
summary: Pentair released its 2022 Corporate Responsibility Report, detailing its efforts to promote sustainability through its water solutions and operational practices. The company reported significant reductions in greenhouse gas emissions, water withdrawals, and advancements in product sustainability assessments. It highlighted that its products support energy and water efficiency, along with responsible supply chain management and diversity inclusion. Pentair aims to address critical water challenges while enhancing its environmental impact.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation as Pentair focuses on minimizing environmental impacts associated with its products, emphasizing sustainability in both its operations and product assessments.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation because Pentair has introduced improved products and processes with a significant focus on sustainability and environmental impact that differentiate them from previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE: Pentair's products, designed to reduce environmental impacts through sustainable manufacturing and operational efficiencies, qualify as green products under the provided definition.
green_process: TRUE: The company has implemented processes that aim to reduce energy consumption and waste while promoting resource conservation, which aligns with the definition of a green process.

greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not indicate greenwashing as Pentair provides verifiable data on its sustainability claims and achievements without making misleading statements.

title: SUSTAINABLE AND EFFICIENT METHODS OF WATER CONSERVATION - Realty Plus Magazine
summary: The article discusses the urgent need for sustainable water management in urban areas due to rapid urbanization and water depletion issues. Experts emphasize the importance of designing integrated systems for water storage, treatment, and recycling to meet future demand. Technologies like IoT for monitoring water usage and efficient adaptation of construction practices, such as using recycled water and leak detection, are highlighted as crucial for responsible water management.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article focuses on innovations related to sustainable water management that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote conservation of water resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it discusses new and improved methods and technologies aimed at water management that differ significantly from previous approaches.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not explicitly mention a specific product that meets the definition of a green product, but focuses more on processes and systems.
green_process: TRUE, as the article describes various sustainable water management techniques and practices that reduce environmental impact and promote efficient resource use.
